Put yourself out there. Go to events, join clubs or take up hobbies where you can meet new people. The more people you interact with, the more chance you have of making friends.
Be open and approachable. Smile, make eye contact and say hi to people. Strike up conversations about everyday things to help break the ice.
Find common interests. Having shared interests, values or experiences helps create connections. Ask people questions to find out what you have in common.
Make plans. Suggest specific days, times and activities when making plans. This shows you want to hang out. Follow through and avoid cancelling.
Be a good listener. Listen closely when others speak. Ask questions to show interest. Avoid interrupting or talking too much about yourself.
Be reliable and supportive. Return favors, keep promises and celebrate accomplishments. Good friends are there for each other.
Meet people through friends. Having mutual friends helps create trust and comfort. Let friends know you want to expand your social circle.
Join community groups. Check out meetups related to your interests or volunteer activities where you can regularly interact with the same people.
Put yourself out there on social media. Connect with acquaintances online and interact with their posts to strengthen bonds.
Stay in touch. Make an effort to maintain connections through things like texts, social media or occasional meetups. Consistent contact helps nurture relationships.
